h2. Problem

The HTTP/1.1 connector defaults to blocking, which can cause a high number of CPU threads. 

h2. Solution
Confluence has already changed the default Tomcat connector to an NIO connector using {{org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11NioProtocol}}, JIRA should consider doing the same.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When running LDAP synchronisation Crowd mechanisms are trying to remove every user in JIRA that is not present in LDAP. Removal won't happen because of fix for JRA-24937.
h3. Expected Results

It won't recalculate when it detects deletion request for user that was deleted more than X minutes ago.
h3. Actual Results

With each user delete event JIRA will clear user count cache.
 When instance is under typical load we experience need of recalculation of user count each cache clear.
h3. Problem

The issue can significantly increase JIRA's response times during user directory synchronisation. The efect is very noticable on instances with high number of inactive users.
h3. Cause

Problem is caused by combination of multiple factors:
 * JIRA leaves inactive users in user pool
 * Crowd has no knowledge of "inactive users"
 * Crowd throws user deletion event for every user separately
 * JIRA checks for licence exceed with request and not by schedule
 * On user delete JIRA needs to recalculate the user count again
 * Directory sync is not atomic operation.
 * Cache invalidation needs to wait for pending cache load to finish
fields.summary: Active user count recalculates for every JIRA's inactive user during user synchronisation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62741].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, it is possible to see the last login date for users only when the user is coming from internal directory or LDAP. It is not possible to see the last login date when the user is coming from Crowd.

h3. Suggested Solution
We need to get the information of last login from Crowd side and add it to the JIRA UI.

h3. Workaround
It is possible to get this information from Crowd database by running the following query : 
{noformat}SELECT u.user_name, a.attribute_value as lastlogin FROM cwd_user u JOIN cwd_user_attribute a ON u.id = a.user_id WHERE attribute_name = 'lastAuthenticated' ORDER BY lastlogin DESC;{noformat}
The result will be in EPOCH time, you would need to convert it to get the exact date. Every successful login attempt from Crowd user in JIRA, JIRA will update the last login value into Crowd database.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to see the last login date for all users even when the user is coming from Crowd

+Issue Summary+

When a user installs the {{Timesheet Report & Gadget for JIRA}} add-on, if they configure a report, save the report and edit to configure the report, the checkboxes selected would be cleared.

+Environment+

This issue has been confirmed to occur on JIRA 7.2.2 and 7.2.1

+How to Reproduce+

# Install the plugin {{Timesheet Report & Gadget for JIRA}} on a vanilla JIRA instance.
# Go to {{Project > Report}} page.
# Select Time Sheet Report.
# Configure the report selecting all the checkboxes.
# Save the settings.
#* Report should show as intended.
# Press the option to reconfigure the report.

+Expected Result+  

JIRA would maintain what was configured for the report.

+Actual Result+

JIRA would drop the selection for the checkboxes.
fields.summary: Timesheet Report & Gadget Report Settings being dropped

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62729].
  {panel}

I would like to have an admin tool for customizing the wiki editor.

I love the drop down menu for adding icons / emoticons. Visual cues are powerful in making lists and illustrating status. I want to add to the list, such as when I want to use a green flag, instead of the red or grey flag provided.

We frequently use a table within a description or comment to track small details about an issue that are too small for ramping up another subtask. We update the list as the items are addressed, by changing the icon.

 


||Status||Description||Example||Tested Date||Test Result||Passed Date||
| |*Aspect of Issue*| | | | |
|(off)|Function 1| | | | |
|(off)|Function 2| | | | |
|(on)|Function 3| |9/1/2016|Success|9/10/2016|
|(flag)|Minor bug|Misspelling of "word".| | | |

This makes comments more manageable, because users of JIRA often offer suggestions that modify the scope of an issue slightly. A little green flag next to a users's comment means the suggestion was implemented, and so forth.

If the multi-character shortcut to be transformed into an icon, along with the path to the image file, could be a customizable table in the admin of the system, that would be great.
fields.summary: admin tool for wiki editor: custom emoticons and styles

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62724].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There are certain scenarios where JIRA will need to be able to connect to itself. JIRA uses the URL the instance is connected to, so the JIRA instance needs to be able to access itself. If it's not able to do so errors will occur. This information is known to cause issues as mentioned here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+fix+gadget+titles+showing+as+__MSG_gadget

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a note on the nginx documentation informing that the JIRA instance needs to be able to access itself and uses the base URL. Therefore network admins would take necessary steps during the proxy setup for this.
fields.summary: Add a note in the nginx documentation about JIRA being able to communicate to itself

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62720].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when users filter the issues by certain groups, they can only see the suggested groups that they belong to. This is quite troublesome for admins as admins are not necessary belong to the groups, but admins might need to filter the issues by groups for reporting/reviewing purpose.

+Example:+
'ABC-Company' groups is created, but admin is not the member of 'ABC-Company'.
Admin is trying to filter the issue {{project = ABC AND reporter in (membersOf(ABC-Company))}}, but ABC-Company is not showing on Suggested Groups

h3. Suggested Resolution
# It should show all groups to the users who belong to 'administrators' group
# Admin can configure whether to show all groups to admins n suggested group

h3. Workaround
* Filter the issues in Advanced mode by manually enter the group's name
fields.summary: As Admin, Group Visibility Should Not Be Restricted

# Rename a JPG file to PNG for example change image.jpg to image.png and save the change.
# Upload the modified file that has been saved as a PNG to JIRA.
# View it in IE.
{panel}

{panel:title=Paste Screen Shot in Visual Mode}
# Access JIRA in Google Chrome browser.
# Take a screen shot.
# Paste the screen shot in a comment field that is in *Visual Mode* and save the comment.
# Access Internet Explorer.
# Attempt to preview the issue.
{panel}

h3. Expected Results

The image renders as it does in Chrome.

h3. Actual Results

The 'Ouch! We can't load the image' error appears.

If you query your JIRA database using the following query:
{code}
SELECT * FROM fileattachment WHERE mimetype != 'text/plain';
{code}

You should see that your attachment is included in the list.

h3. Workaround

# Shutdown Jira
# Backup your database
# Run the following:
{code:sql}
update fileattachment
 set mimetype = 'image/png' 
 where 
 filename like '%.png'
 and mimetype = 'text/plain'
{code}
# Restart Jira and clear your browser cache

h3. Problem Definition
In JIRA 6.4, the project-centric view can be disabled on both the user level or on the global level by an administrator. However, in JIRA 7.2.x, there's no option to disable the sidebar. This is a new feature implemented in JIRA 7.2.x - please refer to [JIRA Core 7.2.x release notes - Projects, front and center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracore/jira-core-7-2-x-release-notes-826896229.html#JIRACore7.2.xreleasenotes-Projects,frontandcenter].

Note that this options is not available for Cloud customers, so it would be nice to have the suggested resolution implemented either way. :)

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users to enable or disable the project navigation sidebar

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently when moving issues in Kanban Board, when using ranking the issues with highest issue number are placed at the bottom. 

The Kanban Board view then scrolls down to where the issue was placed. 

This can be confusing for the customers since it moves the focus to the other column, rather than the one they are working on. Example: Moving issue from _In Review_ to _Done_. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Move the issue to the next column and the focus should remain on the column from when the issue was moved from 

h3. Workaround 
Use swimlines in order to have a more organised view
fields.summary: Remove scroll down on a board when an issue is moved to the bottom of a column whit many issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62707].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In JIRA Datacenter cache for Users and Group is a core for many functionality. Cache flush for them is vert expensive and lead to significant performance degradation of the whole cluster. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add _INFO_ logging event for each cache flush event and additional _DEBUG_ logging with stackrace to track source the flush event. 
 
h3. Implemented solution
* In fixed JIRA version, there is a logging for cache flush events.
{noformat}
2017-01-25 23:55:19,583 http-nio-8090-exec-1 INFO      [c.a.c.e.c.a.j.c.e.ofbiz.EagerOfBizUserCache.userCache] Cache com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.EagerOfBizUserCache.userCache was flushed
{noformat}
* Please note that this logging has no performance impact. 
* How to enable logging for cache flush events: 
*# Navigate to Cog Icon > System > Logging and profiling
*# Find *com.atlassian.cache.event* and set it to _INFO_ level
fields.summary: As an JIRA Administrator for JIRA Datacenter I want to log User cache flush events
Operations dialog should also idenitfy issue by summary

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Some issues whose summaries include words with hyphen "-" didn't hit correctly when searching them.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create the three issues with the following summaries in a project
#* "foo-bar"
#* "foo-123"
# Search the above issues with following JQL
#* {{project = "PROJECTNAME" and summary ~ "bar"}}
#* {{project = "PROJECTNAME" and summary ~ "123"}}

h3. Expected Results
The issue "foo-123" should be hit with the JQL {{project = "PROJECTNAME" and summary ~ "123"}} as "foo-bar" was hit with {{project = "PROJECTNAME" and summary ~ "bar"}}.

h3. Actual Results
No issue was hit with the JQL {{project = "PROJECTNAME" and summary ~ "123"}}.

As [this doc|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARECLOUD/Search+syntax+for+text+fields] said,

{quote}
Whole words only
JIRA cannot search for issues containing parts of words but on whole words only. The exception to this are words which are stemmed.
This limitation can also be overcome using fuzzy searches.
{quote}

JQL allows us to search only *whole words*. When it comes to "foo-bar", the each of "foo" and "bar" is handled as a *whole word*.
On the other hand, "foo-123" seems to be handled as only one "whole word" and we can't search for "foo" and "123".

h3.Workaround
No workaround at this moment.
fields.summary: Issue search for words including hyphen "-" in a text field
casdf

h3. Summary

Documentation implies that *Merge Versions* feature will show all un-archived versions, while it shows archived versions as well

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# See the documentation: [Managing versions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/managing-versions-776636296.html], it says: 
#* {quote}
The 'Merge Versions' popup will be displayed. On this page are two select lists — both listing all un-archived versions. 
{quote} 
# Go to a project in jira
# Create Versions
# Archive the version 
# Click Merge Version
# The archived version is shown there as well 
 
h3. Notes
The documentation needs to be edited to:
{quote}
The 'Merge Versions' popup will be displayed. On this page are two select lists — both listing *all* versions. 
{quote}
fields.summary: Documentation implies that Merge Versions feature will show all un-archived versions, while it shows archived versions as well

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62702].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The links on the welcome to JIRA page all point to the same page.
When first installing jira you are directed to the URL of : http://localhost:8080//secure/MigrationSummary.jspa On this page there is a link that reads 'read about these changes in the migration hub' which links to https://confluence.atlassian.com/migration/jira-7 

Underneath that are 5 entries of product changes, admin changes, licensing changes, user management changes, upgrade task list.  These all also link to https://confluence.atlassian.com/migration/jira-7 instead of the actual page they are referencing.  For example 'Product changes' should link to https://confluence.atlassian.com/migration/jira-7/cloud_jira_product-changes to take you directly to the correct link and so on.

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.0 and above

h3. Steps to Reproduce
navigate to /secure/MigrationSummary.jspa 

h3. Expected Results
Links should point to referenced pages

h3. Actual Results
Links instead point to the same page.
...
{noformat}
fields.summary: Links on Welcome to JIRA page all point to the same page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After modifying the configuration of "Assigned to me" gadget, other gadget's configuration was reset (got lost).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step a new JIRA 7.2.2 instance
 # Create a sample project A
 # Create a dashboard and add two gadget : "Bubble chart" and "Assigned to me"
 # Configure the "Bubble chart" gadget to the project A and save the configuration
 # Configure the "Assigned to me" gadget to display 5 issues and save the configuration
 # Refresh the page

h3. Expected Results

Both gadgets are configured correctly and display the result
h3. Actual Results

The configuration of "Bubble chart" gadget got lost, user has to reconfigure the gadget.
h3. Notes
 * From the Analysis of [~vkrupach1], confirmed on our side: the difference between Bubble Charts and other gadgets. based on 7.4.2 and 7.10.0 Jira sources, the Bubble Charts is the only configurable gadget that is defined as "dashboard-item" that has the _definition_ tag (see [https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/dashboard-item-module/]) while all other gadgets are defined with "replace-gadget-spec-uri" tag (i.e. backward compatibility with old gadgets development approach). So in Jira prior to 7.8.3 saving settings for "replace-gadget-spec-uri" gadgets clears preferences for "definition" gadgets. This means that configurable "dashboard-item" gadgets developed according to the new approach (i.e. with defintion tag) loose their settings when any other gadget is configured.
 * This issue is not present in the latest Jira 7.12.3 and 7.13.0.
fields.summary: Modifying "Assigned to me" gadget reset other gadget's configuration

h3. Problem definition
Today, admins can only perform system backup and restoration from the UI, and manually anonymizing the backup data as per [this guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/sending-jira-data-to-support-147216.html#SendingJIRADatatoSupport-AnonymisingJIRAData]

h3. Suggested solution
A feature to automate the process above

Automate or API call for Integrity Checker

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Summary

Setting an entity property value to a string longer than 255 characters fails returning error 500 if the property type is set to 'string'.

This is because, as mentioned in below documentation page:
 - [https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-platform/building-jira-add-ons/jira-entity-properties-overview]

{quote}
text: tokenized before indexing and allows for searching for particular words.
 string: indexed as-is and allows for searching for the exact phrase only.
{quote}
It should be documented than the limit is 255 characters when using the type 'string' and a better error message should be returned in case a bigger value is provided.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the entity property type to 'string'
 # Send a text longer than 255 character as the property value. E.g. I have sent below body in a REST request as described in: 
{noformat}
https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/properties-setProperty
{noformat}
{noformat}
{  
   "cachedItems":"[{\"id\":\"57dbe48fc0e1d6f6570ccdca\",\"summary\":\"--- template 1\",\"fixed\":false,\"order\":0,\"toggleUser\":\"Mario Thor\",\"toggleDate\":1474028687137},{\"id\":\"57dbe48fc0e1d6f6570ccdcb\",\"summary\":\"abc\",\"fixed\":true,\"order\":1,\"toggleUser\":\"Mario Thor\",\"toggleDate\":1474028704728}]"
}
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

Either 200 OK, or a meaningful error message
h3. Actual Results

You get Error 500 (internal server error) in the REST response and the below exception is thrown in JIRA logs. 
 The same body is accepted without any problem when the type is set to 'text'.
{noformat}

Set the property type to 'text'

h3. Summary

Description not added when JIRA add issues from .msg file

Steps to reproduce:

* Create a .msg file with the following content:
{code:java}
From: test@gmail.com
To: test2@gmail.com
Subject: TEST ISSUE CREATION VIA SAVED EMAIL
Email body: just some random testing
{code}
* Save it as test.msg in {{<JIRAHOME>/import/mail}} directory
* Access JIRA and setup a Mail handler with *Local Files* server and {{Create a new issue from each email}} options. 
* Click *Test* to allow JIRA to process to the email as issue.
* From the Issue navigator, click on newly created issue.
* We'll see that issue is created but it's missing the {{just some random testing}} in the description section.

JIRA 6.4.14, JIRA 7.2.2

Description is added to the issue

h3. Actual Results

Description is not added to the issue

Use any POP or IMAP server to manage mail request

Due to 2 phase plugin system startup, 3rd party plugins may run into problems if

h3. Summary

When updating comment, we can set role and group level security. If we set both of them, JIRA will fail to load them.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set role security level on comment
 # Set group security level on comment
 # Update comment by commentManager

h3. Expected Results

This behaviour should not be permitted.
h3. Actual Results

Comment is saved but can't be loaded from the database. Comment constructor throws IllegalArgumentException which "Cannot specify both group level and role level comment visibility" message.
h3. Workaround

Remove one of security levels from a broken comment.
fields.summary: CommentManager can break comment's consistentcy.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62680].
  {panel}

+Issue Summary+

When a user searches for issues not fulfilling a condition from a select field custom field, JIRA shows the wrong results.

+How to Reproduce+

# Create a single select list custom field.
# Add in 3 options (a,b,c)
#* Leave field default as {{none}} 
# Add the field to a screen.
# Create 4 new issues.
# For each issue, select one of the options for this field
#* Issue 1 = None
#* Issue 2 = a
#* Issue 3 = b
#* Issue 4 = c
# Go to the issue navigator page {{Issues > Search Issues}}
# Switch to advanced search and add the query below:
{code}<your customfield> not in (a,b,c){code}

+Expected Result+ 
JIRA would show you issue 1.

+Actual Restult+
JIRA would show no results.

+Workaround+

You would need to use an {{is EMPTY}} condition to find the issues that have no value set for them.
{code}<your customfield> is EMPTY{code}
fields.summary: JQL search showing Incorrect result

h3. Summary
When an issue is exported using the CSV Exporter (Current Fields) the columns are not shown in the expected order and include the Issue's database ID. 

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.2.X / 7.3.X

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Filter of issues. 
# View this Filter in List View. 
# Add some additional relevant columns. 
# Re-order the filter columns
# Save the filter
# Export the Filter Results as CSV (Current Fields)
# Open the CSV File to find that:
## The Current fields are arranged in default order
## Additional Issue ID and Parent ID fields are added to the CSV output.

h3. Expected Results
The CSV export should be an identical representation of the Filter query in CSV format.

h3. Actual Results
Additional column data is added and the fields are not arranged as per the Filter configuration. 

h3. Notes
The behavior happens with the HTML export as well.

Test

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62677].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when JIRA does the index snapshot, it does not verify if the index files are in a working state. When we recover the index files, it could lead to a situation where we need to rebuild the index by performing a full reindex - this will cause downtime and index recovery suppose to avoid the downtime. This defeats the purpose of the index recovery. 

h3. Suggested Solution
To have a health checker before taking a snapshot. If the index files are not healthy, warn the System Admin and do not perform the snapshot. With this, the Admin will be able to recover the index files that is in the working state and perform a background reindex.
fields.summary: Check for index file health before taking a snapshot

h3. Problem Definition
As explained in the following KB: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-fix-gadget-titles-showing-as-__msg_gadget-813697086.html, the way the gadgets are processed in JIRA has changed for improved performance. However, this has lead to issues other network issues that customers may have on their network due to JIRA not being able to communicate to itself. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Give the admins the abilility to configure the processinfg method to either the old, server side processing or the new method where the gadgets are processed on the client side with improved performance.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When starting a node that has outdated indexes (meaning: not having the latest index operation in the cluster replicated), it is supposed to automatically restore the indexes from the node that registered the latest index operation. However, if that node is unavailable or if that node never wrote a row to {{replicatedindexoperation}}, this will fail and the node will not have the latest index updates. See related JRASERVER-66550

h3. Expected Behavior
Copy indexes from another node that has healthy indexes (have updated the indexes with latest operation).

h3. Actual Behavior
The index restore fails and the below message is registered on the logs of the node that claimed the index restore request.
{noformat:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
2016-09-30 16:25:33,487 ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread:thread-1 INFO      [jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService] Index backup started. Requesting node: node3
2016-09-30 16:25:33,488 ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread:thread-1 WARN      [jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService] Index backup failed - latest index operation not found. Requesting node: node3
{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a new JIRA instance, which will be *node1*;
# Create a new project and some issues.
# Setup another JIRA instance, which will be *node2*. This node will restore the index from node1. *Do not create or modify any issues in this node*.
# Setup yet another JIRA instance, which will be *node3*. This node might attempt to restore the index from *node2.* (it depends which node claims the request first)
# *node2* will fail to create an index snapshot as there are no rows in {{replicatedindexoperation}} having {{node_id = node2}}.

h4. Note
Problem is *node2* shouldn't reply to the index request since it doesn't satisfy sanity check, see JRASERVER-66550. 
That will leave only *node1* as a potential index provider, which fixes the problem. 

h3. Workaround
h5. option1
On the new node in the cluster (node 3, in this case), manually copy the indexes from node 2:
# Go to *Administration > System > Indexing*;
# Under *Copy the Search Index from another node*, select node 2 and copy;

(i) Make sure the indexes on the chosen node are healthy by looking at the *Indexing* health check under the *Administration > System > Support Tools > Health Checks* section of that node.

h5. option2
# Touch any issues at the newly created node, so it will pass sanity check and will be able to share index. 

h5. option3
* Perform a re-index operation on every new node brought up.
fields.summary: Automatic restore of indexes will fail if the node that registered the latest index operation is unavailable
Lost formatting on the Rich Text Editor when navigating between Text and Visual tabs or updating the content

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Restart JIRA 
# Open filter with large number of Versions. 

h3. Expected Results
JIRA populates *Versions* cache quickly. 

h3. Actual Results
JIRA populates *Versions* cache very slow.
Thread is populating the cache in the {{getVersionsByName}} method from DB which is slow: 
{noformat}

   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)
...
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.InsensitiveScrollableResultSet.absoluteInternal(InsensitiveScrollableResultSet.java:979)
...
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.EntityListIterator.getCompleteList(EntityListIterator.java:308)
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.project.version.OfBizVersionStore.getAllVersions(OfBizVersionStore.java:44)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After upgrading from JIRA 7.2 to 7.2.2 and using the built in Russian Language. Accessing components of projects that existed earlier in 7.2 results in an empty page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project and components in JIRA 7.2. (Example: project1)
# Upgrade JIRA 7.2 to 7.2.2.
# Change the system language to Russian. 
# Access the project1's components page.
# An empty page will appear

h3. Expected Results
# The components should appear under the component screen, as it does when the English language is chosen:
 !english-lang.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results 
# When using Russian Language, nothing appears as the screenshot below shows:
 !russian-lang.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
* Change the language to English
fields.summary: Unable to access project components after upgrading from JIRA 7.2 to 7.2.2 when using Russian Language

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62663].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Basically, it is a regression from https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-28173 whereby users who do not have permission to access Confluence are able to see Confluence's status update on JIRA Activity Stream.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.2.1
* Confluence 5.10.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a application link between JIRA and Confluence via 2-legged OAuth
# Login user in JIRA which does not have access to Confluence

h3. Expected Results
Activity Steam gadget in JIRA should not show any Confluence related activity or updates.

h3. Actual Results
Activity Steam gadget in JIRA show any Confluence related activity or updates.
fields.summary: Users who do not have permission to access Confluence are able to see Confluence's status update on JIRA Activity Stream.
Warning before adding existing user in organisation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
IMAP mailbox is queried for non “DELETED” messages, after processing messages are marked as “DELETED” and removed from the server.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be nice to have the possibility to configure mail handlers in JIRA to leave the messages on the mail server after they have been processed.

A similar behavior to the one seen in Service Desk when using IMAP:
{quote}
If you use IMAP, emails are marked as read (not deleted) after they are processed by JIRA Service Desk.
{quote}
(source: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/receiving-requests-by-email-747602718.html])

h3. Note on fix
(i) We will introduce a new "*mark as seen*" checkbox in the UI for handlers using IMAP. 
 !JRASERVER-62660_img.jpg|thumbnail! 
(!) If you decide to switch to "mark as seen" option, please make sure to delete emails from the IMAP folders periodically to prevent unlimited size growth.

Also:
* The current/old handlers should have it "off" by default so the behaviour should be the same as before: processing should delete email from IMAP. 
* There is small change to the way the emails are fetched - before only "not deleted" has been fetched, now "not deleted" + "not seen" - this is to ensure that switching from "checked" to "unchecked" won't process the "seen" mail.
* The previous behaviour of fetch "not deleted" can be restored if needed by using feature flag "_com.atlassian.jira.mailHandlerImapMessageQueryLegacy.enabled_"
fields.summary: Possibility to configure JIRA mail hanlder to mark emails as read (not deleted) after they are processed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Some multi-byte characters on the dashboard (and login page) are garbled in case that user/system language is set to Japanese/Korean/Chinese.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a vanilla JIRA 7.2.2
# Set the default language to Japanese

h3. Expected Results
The characters should be shown correctly as follows.

h3. Actual Results
Some characters are garbled as follows.
 !login.png|thumbnail! 
 !dashboard.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Note
This problem didn't occurred on JIRA 7.1.x.

h3.Workaround
* Add {{-Dfile.encoding=UTF-8}} to JVM startup option with following the way introduced in [Setting properties and options on startup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-828788225.html]
* Set {{LANG=ja_JP.UTF-8}} to the environment variables
fields.summary: Some multi-byte characters on dashboard are garbled in case that user/system language is set to Japanese/Korean/Chinese
Allow the Reporter field to default to Blank

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA allows installing JIRA Software 7.2.x on JIRA Core 7.1.x by uploading the application .obr
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JIRA 7.1.x
 # Download JIRA Software 7.2.x from [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.jira-software-application/versions]
 # Click *Upload an application* and select the file downloaded on the previous step.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should throw an error and not allow the application to install.
h3. Actual Results

JIRA installs JIRA Software 7.2.x but does not activate it, since it is incompatible. On the *Applications and Licenses* page the following error message is shown:
 - *JIRA Core must be updated to be compatible with this version of JIRA Software.*
 !Screen Shot 2016-09-29 at 5.32.45 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
 * If JIRA Software is not previously installed, JIRA refuses to install the incompatible JIRA Software application, which is the expected behaviour.
 * To rollback to JIRA Software 7.1.x it is necessary to uninstall JIRA Software 7.2.x by clicking *Uninstall* and clicking *Install* after the uninstallation completes.

h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: JIRA allows installing JIRA Software 7.2.x on JIRA Core 7.1.x by uploading the application .obr

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62655].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
We can't set users to delete projects without admin permissions on a Cloud instance.

h3. Suggestion
Create a permission on the Cloud instance or project roles in the project that administrators can allow users to delete projects in JIRA.

h3. Workaround
Ask for an administrator.
fields.summary: Delete projects without admin permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The option to export to Excel has been removed, however, if you are in a backlog and right click > View in Excel you get a 404 error. If you enable the feature Excel (or whatever you use) will open.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # View Backlog
 # Right Click
 # Choose View in Excel

h3. Expected Results

Excel should open with the requested issue, etc.
h3. Actual Results

You get directed to a 404 page
h3. Notes

Removing that option when you right click would cause less confusion for the customers
h3. Workaround

Enable the Excel export by doing the following: 

# Open the jira-config.properties file inside JIRA's Home Directory (or create it, if it doesn't exist)
# Add the below property to the file:
{code}jira.export.excel.enabled = true{code}
# Save the file
# Restart JIRA
fields.summary: Clicking View in Excel from Backlog causes 404 Error

fields.description:
For the last few months I've been getting the annoying "New issue edits" dialog on JAC for my own changes.
It's so annoying there must be an issue for this, but I couldn't find it.

Steps to reproduce:

fields.description:
The ecosystem is advised that they can create dialogs that appear when dropdown items in the header are clicked:

https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-platform/guides/issues/tutorial-displaying-content-in-a-dialog-in-jira

This involves adding a {{styleClass}} attribute to a {{<web-item>}} destined to be inserted in to the application header.

With the AUI upgrade that occurred in JIRA 7.2 came a refactor of how the dropdowns in the header were rendered. This refactor omitted the {{styleClass}} from being added to the dropdown items. 

To fix:

# The {{styleClass}} needs to be added back to the dropdown item's {{<a>}} tag, and 
# An automated test needs to be written to cover this ecosystem extension point.
fields.summary: styleClass is not added to dropdown items in header menus

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62640].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
New Atlassian Connect add-ons create users in the application so they can perform some operations. Some of these operations can trigger notification events.
For example the new JIRA Misc Workflow Extensions (JMWE) add-on user sends a notification when a the add-on reassigns the issue to another user by way of a workflow post-function

h3. Suggested Solution
As a JIRA admin I'd like to disable notifications from these system users from Atlassian Connect add-ons.
 
h3. Workaround 
You could remove the Issue Assigned event from the project notification scheme, but this will stop this kind of notifications from all users, not just system ones.
fields.summary: Ability to disable notifications from system users (including add-ons
